Algorithm Module¶

This Python module contains a collection of generic algorithms used in PyRate

pyrate.algorithm.get_all_epochs(ifgs)[source]¶

Returns a sequence of all master and slave dates in given interferograms.

Parameters:ifgs (list) – List of interferogram objects
Returns:master and slave dates
Return type:list
pyrate.algorithm.get_epochs(ifgs)[source]¶

Returns an EpochList derived from the given interferograms.

Parameters:ifgs (list) – List of interferogram objects
Returns:EpochList
Return type:list
pyrate.algorithm.ifg_date_index_lookup(ifgs, date_pair)[source]¶

Returns the Interferogram index which has the master and slave dates given in ‘date_pair’.

Parameters:
  • ifgs (list) – List of interferogram objects to search
  • date_pair (tuple) – A (datetime.date, datetime.date)
Returns:

interferogram index
Return type:

int
pyrate.algorithm.ifg_date_lookup(ifgs, date_pair)[source]¶

Returns the Interferogram which has the master and slave dates given in ‘date_pair’.

Parameters:
  • ifgs (list) – List of interferogram objects to search
  • date_pair (tuple) – A (datetime.date, datetime.date)
Returns:

interferogram list
Return type:

list
pyrate.algorithm.is_square(arr)[source]¶

Determines whether an array is square or not.

Parameters:arr (ndarray) – numpy array
Returns:condition
Return type:bool
pyrate.algorithm.least_squares_covariance(A, b, v)[source]¶

Least squares solution in the presence of known covariance. This function is known as lscov() in MATLAB.

Parameters:
  • A (ndarray) – Design matrix
  • b (ndarray) – Observations (vector of phase values)
  • v (ndarray) – Covariances (vector of weights)
Returns:

solution
Return type:

ndarray
pyrate.algorithm.los_conversion(phase_data, unit_vec)[source]¶

Converts phase from line-of-sight (LOS) to horizontal/vertical components.

Parameters:
  • phase_data (ndarray) – Phase band data array (eg. ifg.phase_data)
  • unit_vec (tuple) – 3 component unit vector e.g. (EW, NS, vertical)
Returns:

converted_phase
Return type:

ndarray
pyrate.algorithm.master_slave_ids(dates)[source]¶

Returns a dictionary of ‘date:unique ID’ for each date in ‘dates’. IDs are ordered from oldest to newest, starting at 0. Implements ifglist.mas|slvnum used in the Matlab Pirate package.

Parameters:dates (list) – List of dates
Returns:unique dates IDs
Return type:dict
pyrate.algorithm.unit_vector(incidence, azimuth)[source]¶

Returns unit vector tuple (east_west, north_south, vertical).

Parameters:
  • incidence (float) – incidence angle w.r.t. nadir
  • azimuth (float) – azimuth of looking vector
Returns:

Unit vector (EW, NS, vertical).
Return type:

tuple
